definition: to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge/also written 淺嘗輒止|浅尝辄止
shallow/light (color)
sound of moving water
variant of 嘗|尝[chang2]/to taste/to experience
to taste/to try/to experience/already/ever/once
old variant of 嘗|尝[chang2]
variant of 輒|辄[zhe2]
then/at once/always/(archaic) luggage rack on a chariot
to stop/to prohibit/until/only

sentences.english: I have not the gifts that are necessary for scholarship.
sentences.chinese: 浅尝辄止的人是无法做学问的。

sentences.english: The theory of elegance seeking in poetry and ode was seldom paid adequate attention to in academic field.
sentences.chinese: 曹丕的“诗赋欲丽说”学界虽有关注，但都浅尝辄止。

sentences.english: Don't be content to just skim over courses with "only to pass".
sentences.chinese: 不要只满足于对功课浅尝辄止，“只求及格”。

sentences.english: Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed.
sentences.chinese: 有些书只需浅尝辄止，有些书该囫囵吞食。

sentences.english: Of course, we have only just touched on some of its possibilities.
sentences.chinese: 当然，我们仅是浅尝辄止而已。

definition: dilettante/amateur/to dabble in/to flirt with (a topic)
dilettante/amateur/to dabble in/to flirt with (a topic)
lit. the dragonfly touches the water lightly/superficial contact (idiom)
to swallow in one gulp (idiom)/(fig.) to accept without thinking/to lap up
to speak in general terms
lit. not requiring a detailed understanding (idiom); only looking for an overview/not bothered with the details/superficial/content with shallow understanding
to touch on sth and leave it there/to take care not to overdo sth
lit. to scratch the outside of the boot (idiom)/fig. beside the point/ineffectual
to change (for the worse)
to give up halfway (idiom); leave sth unfinished
tastes as if one is chewing wax (idiom)/tasteless/insipid
to skimp/to work half-heartedly/not to bother
to do sth once in a while (idiom)/to do sth more as an exception than the rule
lit. flower viewing from horseback (idiom); a fleeting glance in passing/fig. superficial understanding from cursory observation/to make a quick judgment based on inadequate information

lit. military tactics on paper (idiom)/fig. theoretical discussion that is worse than useless in practice/armchair strategist/idle theorizing/cf Zhao Kuo 趙括|赵括 leading an army of 400,000 to total annihilation at battle of Changping 長平之戰|长平之战 in 260 BC
vague and general/not specific/shallow/empty
anxious for quick results (idiom); to demand instant success/impatient for result/impetuous
